Yale
Computer
Society

Students promoting computer science and engineering at Yale University

and learn about events and opportunities

Tech Prize

Up to $1000 for the first place

Make teams of and compete for. Learn more.

What we do

We organize talks about technology and entrepreneurship, study sessions for the main Computer Science classes, the Yale's one and only Tech Career Fair.

Join our weekly dinners. Wednesdays 6pm at Jonathan Edwards Dining Hall.

Events

Scheduled talks and workshops for 2016-2017.

Past events

    December

    Study sessions for finals

    Come study with friends at the CEID. Check out our events on Facebook to find the times for you class. Lots of cookies await for you.

    All weekend, starting December 10th. CEID.

    Interview Workshop I

    Learn about the process of interviewing for the main tech companies, the coding challenges and how to prepare for them. Dinner (pizza & cookies) will be provided.

    Monday, December 5th. 7-9pm. AKW 100.

    November

    Julia Austin

    CTO at DigitalOcean and Senior Lecturer at Harvard Business School. Previosuly at VMWare and Akamai.

    Thursday, November 3rd. 11:45am-12:45. Lunch at the CEID.

    September

    Tom Lehman, Y '06

    CEO & Co-founder of Genius, formerly Rap Genius, the world’s biggest collection of song lyrics and crowdsourced musical knowledge.

    Friday, September 30th. 7pm to 8:15pm. At Sudler Hall.

    Abhishek Chandra, Y '16

    CTO of Spring.Care, a healthcare company using data-driven technology to diagnose depression.

    Friday, September 9th. 4:30pm to 6pm. At CEID.

The YCS is a undergraduate organization that promotes talks, workshops and study breaks related to computer science and engineering on Yale campus.

Email felipe.pires@y[you know the rest].edu with questions or suggestions.

Copyright 2016. All rights reserved.

Join YCS

If you are interested in the work we do and would like to help us do more, you should consider joining our team. You can either:

  • come to our weekly dinners (JE dining hall, Wednesdays at 6pm) and see what we're up to, or
  • send a message to Felipe Pires saying you're interested in helping out.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.
